text: Carmel Budiardjo (née Brickman; 18 June 1925 – 10 July 2021) was a British- Indonesian human rights activist. She was the founder of the organisation Tapol. She also won the Right Livelihood Award in 1995. Budiardjo was born in London.Rights activist says genocide continues in Indonesia, JWeekly, Saturday, 26 October 1996 She was known for raising awareness and her campaigns against human rights violations in Indonesia and East Timor.I'll campaign for Timor until I die, The Independent, 25 October 1998 Budiardjo died in London on 10 July 2021, aged 96. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2021 deaths Category:British human rights activists Category:People from London Category:Indonesian activists
